[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Movie Shop System (MSS) defines requirements for handling movie orders, catalog browsing, and user subscriptions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MSS supports subscriptions, rentals, purchases, credit updates, and automated ordering of unavailable titles.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MSS integrates with payment systems, inventory databases, and customer records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MSS provides dashboards for browsing, renting, purchasing, and managing subscriptions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MSS supports web-based and POS terminals.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MSS uses PostgreSQL for storage, REST APIs for integration with payments and inventory.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MSS secures data via OAuth 2.0, JWT authentication, and HTTPS encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: MSS optimizes storage for large-scale transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: MSS ensures 24/7 availability with periodic maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: MSS supports multiple store branches and online platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: MSS integrates with cloud/on-premise deployments, linking with suppliers for automated ordering.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MSS manages rentals, purchases, subscriptions, credit tracking, and order processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: MSS is used by customers, subscribers, and store administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: MSS requires internet for real-time subscription verification and inventory updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MSS relies on payment gateways, suppliers, and customer verification systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Rechargeable Card: Prepaid card for renting movies.
Movie Order: Request for unavailable movies.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with payment gateways for purchases and recharges.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect with movie suppliers to order unavailable movies.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to TO-BE-DEFINED (REQ-DB-001, REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable subscribers to rent movies using rechargeable cards, deducting balance and updating credits (REQ-DB-001, REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall automatically order unavailable movies from suppliers (REQ-DB-001, REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a catalog interface with filtering, search, and recommendations.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process rentals and purchases within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store customer details, rental and purchase history, and subscriptions.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique customer IDs and maintain transaction logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with financial security and data protection regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log all rental, purchase, and recharge transactions for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests for rentals, purchases, recharges, and automatic ordering.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and transaction policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Movie rental, financial, and data privacy regulations.
